title: Dominant Chimaev wrestles Du Plessis' title away
content: Khamzat Chimaev controlled Dricus Du Plessis for more than 21 minutes and set a UFC record for total strikes to win the middleweight title Saturday at UFC 319.

title: Brewers rally again to win record 14th straight
content: Andruw Monasterio hit a three-run home run in the 11th inning, and the Milwaukee Brewers won their franchise-record 14th game.

title: Chargers' Johnston has concussion after hard hit
content: Chargers WR Quentin Johnston exited Saturday's preseason game on a cart after taking a big hit that left him motionless for several minutes, and head coach Jim Harbaugh said he has a concussion.

title: 'I've arrived': Jeanty makes powerful statement
content: Rookie RB Ashton Jeanty had his "I'm here" moment against the 49ers on Saturday, delivering some big plays -- and big hits -- in the Raiders' second preseason game.

title: Dart impresses again, but QB plans unchanged
content: Giants rookie Jaxson Dart continues to impress in preseason, but coach Brian Daboll reiterated that Russell Wilson is still New York's starting quarterback.

title: Harbaugh mum on U-M sanctions: 'Not engaging'
content: Jim Harbaugh is refusing to comment on the NCAA's decision to fine Michigan tens of millions of dollars and to suspend football coach Sherrone Moore for a third game due to the sign-stealing scandal that occurred during Harbaugh's tenure there.

title: White: 'Billion-to-1' odds Jones fights on WH card
content: UFC CEO Dana White all but nixed the idea of Jon Jones fighting at the promotion's proposed event at the White House in 2026, saying, "I would not bet on it."

title: Ravens' Loop drills 5 FGs, now Tucker's successor
content: Ravens rookie Tyler Loop was officially announced as the successor to Justin Tucker after he made 5 of 6 field goals Saturday, including ones from 51 and 53 yards.

title: Ultimate Draft Board: Perfect picks for every round in a 12-team league
content: Mike Clay provides his blueprint for 2025 fantasy football drafts, including ideal selections in each round and overall strategy.

title: Tory Horton, Jaxson Dart, Adonai Mitchell among deep sleepers for 2025
content: These sleepers are truly for those in deeper leagues seeking off-the-radar types who may emerge in 2025.

title: Why Bryce Young, C.J. Stroud's childhood bond will 'never waver'
content: Their friendship dates back to AAU hoops and a high school football game to settle the best team in California.

title: Stacking the best, worst positional groups in the NFL: 1-32 rankings, plus roster outlooks
content: Which team has the best wide receivers? The shakiest edge rusher room? We ranked all 32 teams in 10 position groups.

title: Inside the strategy of organizing an NFL locker room
content: NFL coaches are always looking for an edge, and some believe that can be found in the locker room seating chart.

title: Bowl projections: Every matchup from the Celebration Bowl to the national title game
content: It's August and no games have been played, but we're breaking down who will be where in December and beyond.

title: Juan Soto's shuffle bat among best from MLB Players' Weekend
content: Players' Weekend allows player to don and use custom gear reflecting three themes: off-field interests, causes and appreciation.

title: Little League, big dreams: Mets, Mariners players as Little Leaguers
content: From Cal Raleigh to Juan Soto, here's what players in this year's Little League Classic looked like as Little Leaguers themselves.

title: The Hockey Diversity Alliance turns 5: Challenges, triumphs, what's next
content: What started as a group chat in 2020 has become a force for change in expanding hockey to underserved communities.

title: Dive into the ESPN/KFF Survey of 1988 NFL Players
content: Read the key takeaways and methodology of the ESPN/KFF Survey of 1988 NFL Players, and see additional stories and videos from the project.

title: üéµ Taylor Swift joins Kelce brothers on 'New Heights'
content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan -- and even caught Caitlin Clark's attention.

title: üìà NFL Future Power Rankings
content: We ranked all 32 NFL franchises' expectations for 2025 through 2027. Which teams are set up to thrive in the future?

title: üèà Predicting best, worst scenarios for NFL teams
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: üèÄ Is there any coming back for banned Knicks fans?
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: Is Flagg a ROY lock? How 11 rookies can challenge the No. 1 pick
content: NBA analyst Kevin Pelton groups 11 players most likely to threaten the Mavericks' No. 1 pick for the auspicious award.

title: A White House nod boosts the stature of once-shunned MMA
content: Dana White recounts sport's long journey from 'human cockfighting' obscurity to a presidential embrace

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to bring De Gea back?
content: Manchester United could bring goalkeeper David de Gea back to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Watch: CCTV captures moment of firing at Elvish Yadav‚Äôs Gurgaon home
content: A shocking CCTV footage revealed two masked men firing over ten rounds outside YouTuber Elvish Yadav's Gurgaon residence. Gangsters Neeraj Faridpur and Bhau Ritolia, associated with the Himanshu Bhau gang, claimed responsibility, alleging Yadav promoted a betting app. Fortunately, no one was injured, and police have launched an investigation, analyzing CCTV evidence to apprehend the suspects.

title: PM Modi inaugurates Rs11,000-cr worth highway projects for Delhi-NCR
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated two significant highway projects in Delhi-NCR, totaling nearly Rs 11,000 crore. These projects include the Delhi section of the Dwarka Expressway and the Alipur‚ÄìDichaon Kalan stretch of Urban Extension Road-II (UER-II).

title: 'Asked to improve': Pakistan coach reveals why Babar Azam was left out of Asia Cup
content: Pakistan unveiled its squad for the upcoming T20I series and Asia Cup, notably excluding Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan in a strategic shift towards aggressive batting. Coach Mike Hesson emphasized Babar's need to improve his strike rate and play against spin, suggesting his participation in the Big Bash League as a crucial opportunity to showcase his evolution.

title: Rahul Gandhi calls SIR 'conspiracy to steal Bihar election'; attacks ECI
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of India of plotting to rig the upcoming Bihar elections. He claimed that elections are being stolen nationwide. Gandhi asserted that the INDIA bloc will conduct a caste census. He thanked Lalu Prasad Yadav for attending the rally despite health concerns. The Congress leader addressed a 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' event in Sasaram, Bihar.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says that he is not as "well-suited" to be CEO of ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has expressed reservations about leading the company should it go public, citing a mismatch between his skills and the demands of a public company CEO. Despite this, OpenAI is moving forward with ambitious plans to invest trillions in computing infrastructure, exploring novel financial instruments to fund this expansion.

title: Delhi: Man rapes mother after accusing her of having 'bad character'
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Hauz Qazi, a 39-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping his mother. The woman, who had just returned from a pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia with her husband and daughter, accused her son, Md Firoz, of multiple sexual assaults this month.

title: Explained: The rise of fake productivity at work to look busy
content: A new workplace habit called fake productivity is spreading. Many employees pretend to be busy to manage work-life balance. Leaders are concerned about productivity in hybrid work environments. Task-masking involves doing micro-tasks to show effort without achieving real results. This behavior is linked to return-to-office pressures and surveillance. Telepressure from constant messaging leads to burnout.

title: 'Industrial-scale liar': BJP reacts after Gurkirat Dang denies voting multiple times
content: BJP IT Cell head Amit Malviya has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's claims of electoral irregularities, labeling him a liar after Gandhi alleged multiple voting instances. Malviya highlighted Gurkirat Singh Dang's public denial of Gandhi's accusations, where Dang refuted voting multiple times and demanded evidence or an apology. The BJP dismisses Gandhi's allegations as baseless and politically motivated.

title: ‚Äò82% stake sold‚Äô: Tesla exec offloads shares; Musk renews short seller threat
content: Tesla's Tom Zhu has sold over 82% of his Tesla shares since 2023. The sales occurred between 2023 and 2024. Elon Musk warned short sellers of potential losses if Tesla achieves full autonomy. Musk has clashed with Bill Gates over Gates' alleged short position against Tesla. This position reportedly cost Gates $1.5 billion.

title: E20 fuel rollout: Mileage dip, engine woes reported‚Äî what car owners have to say
content: The rollout of E20 fuel in India has sparked concerns among vehicle owners regarding fuel efficiency and performance. Many report mileage drops and engine issues, particularly in non-E20-compliant vehicles. While the government touts economic and environmental benefits, experts emphasize the need for greater consumer awareness and OEM education to mitigate negative impacts.

title: Man sends bomb to love interest‚Äôs husband in music speaker
content: Chhattisgarh police foiled a murder plot by arresting Vinay Verma, who sent an IED disguised as a music system to the husband of a woman he was obsessed with. The investigation uncovered an illegal explosives supply network, leading to six more arrests. Authorities seized gelatin sticks and detonators, revealing a dangerous scheme and preventing a potential tragedy.

title: China hands over third Hangor-class submarine to Pakistan
content: China's delivery of the third Hangor-class submarine to Pakistan significantly enhances Islamabad's naval capabilities amidst Beijing's growing presence in the Indian Ocean. Equipped with advanced sensors and weaponry, these submarines aim to maintain regional power balance and maritime security, according to Pakistani officials.

title: Microsoft's new return to office plan: Company requires 3-day office attendance; Announcement in Sep
content: Microsoft is mandating a return to office for employees near its Redmond headquarters, requiring at least three days a week in-person starting January 2025. This shift aligns Microsoft with other tech giants like Amazon, Google and Meta, tightening remote work policies.

title: BO collection day 4: 'War 2' crosses Rs 150 cr mark; ‚ÄòCoolie‚Äô close to Rs 170 cr
content: The spy thriller 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani, had a strong opening, earning ‚Çπ52 Cr on its first day and crossing ‚Çπ150 crore by day four. Despite competition from Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' which initially led, 'War 2' saw a dip in collections after the initial surge.

title: Farewell to Dan Tana: The man behind LA‚Äôs legendary ‚ÄòLittle Yellow House‚Äô
content: Dan Tana, the Serbian-born restaurateur behind the iconic Dan Tana's in West Hollywood, has died at 90. From soccer player to actor, he found his calling in hospitality, creating a beloved Italian-American spot in 1964. His restaurant became a haven for celebrities, known for its classic vibe and hearty dishes, leaving behind a lasting legacy.

title: Uncertainty over US-India trade deal as August talks put off
content: The Trump administration has introduced new uncertainty into the bilateral trade deal with India by postponing scheduled meetings, leaving Indian authorities awaiting clarity. A deadline looms for potential doubling of tariffs on Indian exports to the US. This situation is further complicated by existing tariffs and proposed secondary sanctions related to India's trade with Russia.

title: 'Thank Nitish for smooth roads': Bihar minister jabs Rahul Gandhi ahead of 'big yatra'
content: Ahead of Congress's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' launch in Sasaram, Bihar minister Ashok Choudhary took a dig at Rahul Gandhi, suggesting he should thank CM Nitish Kumar for the improved roads that made the rally possible. The yatra, protesting the Election Commission's electoral roll revision, aims to raise awareness about voter exclusion.

title: Caught on cam: SUV crushes labourer while fleeing after vehicle brawl
content: In Jaipur, a 35-year-old labourer named Chandra Shekhar was fatally run over by an SUV driver following a road rage incident on Sikar Road. The clash initially erupted between a Scorpio and a Brezza, escalating when men from the Scorpio smashed the Brezza's windows.

title: Himanshu Bhau gang takes responsibility for firing at Elvish Yadav‚Äôs house
content: The Bhau gang has claimed responsibility for a firing incident outside YouTuber Elvish Yadav's Gurgaon residence, citing his promotion of betting apps as the motive. Three masked men on a motorbike reportedly fired around 15 bullets at the house early Sunday morning, while Elvish was not present.

title: Four simple secrets to longevity: 97-yr-old doctor reveals; 'you can lose upto 10% of your muscle mass'
content: Water functions as the fundamental essential nutrient required for sustaining human existence. The body functions optimally through hydration, especially when it comes to heart function, brain operation and muscle performance. Scientific research indicates that people who drink adequate water have reduced probabilities of heart and lung diseases, along with developing chronic conditions

title: Widespread malnutrition in Gaza: Woman evacuated on humanitarian flight dies in Italy
content: Marah Abu Zuhri, a 20-year-old Palestinian woman evacuated from Gaza to Italy for malnutrition treatment, tragically died in a Pisa hospital shortly after arrival. Suffering from severe organic wasting, her case highlights the dire humanitarian crisis in Gaza, where widespread malnutrition and starvation are escalating due to the ongoing conflict.

title: Tragedy! Brighton fan dies after collapsing during Premier League game; but match continued
content: A 72-year-old Brighton & Hove Albion supporter tragically passed away during their Premier League match against Fulham. Despite immediate medical attention, including CPR and defibrillation, he could not be revived. The club expressed deep condolences, acknowledging the emotional impact on staff and supporters. Despite the incident, the game continued, and the club later clarified the reasoning.

title: Asia Cup: Pakistan drop bombshell ‚Äì Babar, Rizwan axed from 17-member squad
content: Pakistan cricket has announced its squad for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025 and the T20I tri-series in the UAE, surprisingly excluding Babar Azam and Mohammed Rizwan. Salman Ali Agha will captain the team, which includes a mix of experienced players like Fakhar Zaman and Shaheen Afridi, alongside promising youngsters.

title: Typical 90s cricket in Pakistan: When Basit Ali tried to outsmart everyone after being bowled ‚Äì Watch
content: A resurfaced video shows former Pakistani batter Basit Ali's questionable sportsmanship during a match against Zimbabwe in the 90s, where he attempted to deceive the umpire after being dismissed. More recently, Ali has criticized the Pakistan cricket team and urged India to boycott the Asia Cup, predicting a severe defeat for Pakistan.

title: IND vs PAK | ‚ÄòAfridi has eaten dog meat‚Äô ‚Äì Pathan recalls ugly war of words
content: Irfan Pathan has ignited the India-Pakistan rivalry with a candid recollection of his clashes with Shahid Afridi. Pathan revealed Afridi's controversial jibes, including a bizarre claim about eating dog meat, fueled his determination. He recounted a heated exchange during a 2006 flight, where he silenced Afridi's taunts with a sharp retort, asserting his verbal dominance over the former Pakistani captain.

title: Save Delhi-NCR strays: When RSS chief & Rahul Gandhi speak in unison for the voiceless
content: A rare consensus has emerged in Indian politics as leaders from opposing ideologies, including RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat and Congress' Rahul and Priyanka Gandhi, unite against the Supreme Court's order to remove stray dogs from Delhi-NCR. They advocate for humane population control methods like sterilization and vaccination, criticizing the order as cruel and impractical.

title: Police book Eknath Khadse‚Äôs son-in-law over objectionable content found on mobile
content: Pranjal Khewalkar, son-in-law of former minister Eknath Khadse, faces a new case filed by a Mumbai model. She alleges Khewalkar lured her to hotels under the guise of creating a portfolio, where he photographed and recorded her in compromising positions without consent.

title: LA high school senior was walking his dog when ICE took him into custody
content: In Los Angeles, an 18-year-old high school senior, Benjamin Marcelo Guerrero Cruz, was detained by ICE for allegedly overstaying his visa, sparking outrage and concern. The LAUSD is responding by increasing security around schools. Cruz's teammates and community members are rallying to support him and his family, highlighting his positive character and the impact of his absence.

title: 'Gonna blow you up': Woman arrested for bomb threat to University of Central Florida
content: Kristin Galli, a 29-year-old Florida woman, was arrested for allegedly making a bomb threat to the University of Central Florida after drunkenly calling Student Care Services. She also sent a barrage of incoherent texts and photos to a UCF professor.

title: Elvish Yadav‚Äôs Gurgaon house attacked: 3 bike-borne men fire 15 bullets
content: In Gurgaon's sector 57, unidentified individuals fired shots outside the residence of Elvish Yadav, the controversial YouTuber and Bigg Boss winner, between 5:30 am and 6 am. Elvish Yadav was not present at his home during the incident, where men on motorbikes discharged firearms before fleeing.

title: ‚ÄòTorrents of muddy water‚Äô: Video shows Kullu flash floods; NH blocked
content: Flash floods triggered by incessant heavy rainfall and a cloudburst have caused widespread disruption in Mandi district, Himachal Pradesh, blocking the Chandigarh-Manali National Highway. While no casualties have been reported so far, the floods exacerbate the state's already devastating monsoon season, which has seen 261 deaths and massive infrastructure damage.

title: 'RSS is Indian Taliban': Senior Congress leader BK Hariprasad
content: A senior Congress leader, BK Hariprasad, has sparked controversy by likening the RSS to the "Indian Taliban," a day after Prime Minister Modi lauded the organization's contributions during his Independence Day speech. Hariprasad questioned the RSS's financial transparency and historical role, alleging their involvement in the Partition resolution.

title: Dalit family ousted from village after inter-caste marriage; home vandalised
content: A Dalit family in Muktsar district is living away from their village after their son's inter-caste marriage sparked outrage. The family alleges their home was vandalized and looted, prompting a police investigation and the arrest of three individuals, including the girl's father and brother.

title: 64-year-old retd Army officer on bicycle killed by SUV; incident caught on cam
content: A retired Army Captain, Narsa Ram Jajra, was fatally struck by a speeding SUV while cycling to his morning walk in Jaipur. The driver, identified as a woman, fled the scene after running him over near Gopi Kachori on Gandhi Path.

title: 'Didn't brush his teeth for days': Ex-England cricketer reveals tactic used by wicketkeeper
content: Phil Tufnell revealed Jack Russell's unusual tactic of skipping brushing his teeth to unsettle batters, highlighting the psychological games in cricket. West Indies' Carlos Brathwaite emphasized how a wicketkeeper's chatter influences the game's energy, either irritating batters or boosting bowlers. Wicketkeepers use various methods, from banter to quirky routines, to impact the game beyond their primary role.

title: Asia Cup | Batting for continuity? For Gambhir, it‚Äôs all about the result
content: Gautam Gambhir, fresh off a drawn Test series in England, is set to reshape India's T20I team. With senior players retired, Gambhir is implementing his philosophy, prioritizing IPL talent and specialist players. He emphasizes impactful plays on every ball and values all-rounders for increased flexibility.

title: Elvish Yadav house firing: Gunshots outside Gurugram residence; bullet holes spotted
content: Elvish Yadav's Gurugram residence in Sector 57 was attacked early Sunday morning by three unidentified assailants on motorcycles, who fired over two dozen rounds. Elvish was not home during the incident, but family members were present. No one was injured, and police are investigating, collecting forensic evidence and reviewing CCTV footage to identify the attackers.

title: 'Prince Andrew was horrible to staff‚Äô: Bombshell revelations in new documentary
content: Prince Andrew faces renewed scrutiny over his alleged mistreatment of staff, detailed in a Channel 5 documentary and Andrew Lownie's new book. Accusations include summoning staff for trivial tasks like picking up golf balls and tissues. Further claims suggest Andrew once requested a staff member's transfer due to a mole on his face and another for wearing a nylon tie.

title: Ukraine to lose Donbas? Trump plans Putin-Zelenskyy talks before Aug 22
content: Donald Trump is reportedly planning a trilateral meeting with Vladimir Putin and Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington before April 22nd. This comes amid claims Trump suggested Ukraine cede control of the Donbas region for a ceasefire, aligning with Putin's demands. While Zelenskyy rejects territorial concessions, he's open to summit discussions, seeking security guarantees and an end to the conflict.

title: 'Crossed all limits': Cong demands machine-readable electoral rolls
content: The Congress party has strongly criticized the Election Commission, accusing it of failing its constitutional duty and exhibiting "shamelessness" regarding alleged vote theft and rigging. K C Venugopal questioned the EC's transparency, citing denial of machine-readable rolls and deletion of CCTV footage.

title: Flash floods in Himachal: Mandi, Kullu, Kinnaur worst hit; highway blocked
content: Flash floods in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district have severely disrupted connectivity, particularly along the Chandigarh-Manali National Highway. Heavy rainfall across the state has resulted in numerous road closures, power outages, and water supply disruptions, with Mandi, Kullu, and Kinnaur being the most affected.

title: ‚ÄòAsk ChatGPT‚Äô: Parameshwara says he‚Äôs India‚Äôs no.1 HM after ‚ÄòI don‚Äôt know‚Äô row
content: Karnataka's Home Minister G Parameshwara is facing online trolling for his frequent use of "I don't know" in response to questions. He has now retorted by citing ChatGPT, claiming it ranks him as India's top home minister. Parameshwara defended his approach, stating he avoids speculation without complete information and urged media to report mistakes internally before publicizing them.

title: IND vs ENG | Ex-India cricketer hits out - 'Two Tests India won...'
content: Sanjay Manjrekar has criticized Jasprit Bumrah's recent performance, highlighting India's Test victories in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy came in matches where Bumrah was absent. Manjrekar suggests that Indian cricket should not make adjustments for Bumrah, instead, Bumrah should prioritize longevity and durability to serve Indian Test cricket effectively.

title: Padma Shri awardee Bula Choudhury robbed: 150 medals, mementos stolen
content: Former Indian swimmer Bula Choudhury, also known as the 'Queen of Seas,' suffered a devastating loss as thieves broke into her Hindmotor house and stole over 150 medals and mementos, including her Padma Shri brooch and 10 SAF Games gold medals. This marks the third theft at her residence, with previous incidents in 2014 involving stolen jewelry and electronics.

title: ‚ÄòVoter Adhikar Yatra‚Äô: BJP using Election Commission of India to snatch people‚Äôs right to vote, says Tejashwi Yadav
content: Addressing a public rally after the launch of Congress‚Äô ‚ÄòVoter Adhikar Yatra‚Äô in Sasaram, Mr. Yadav termed the SIR as ‚Äúdacoity of votes‚Äù, ‚Äúwhich we will not let happen at any cost‚Äù

title: PM Modi inaugurates two highways worth ‚Çπ11,000 crore to decongest Delhi
content: ‚ÄúDwarka Expressway and UER-II will benefit people of Delhi-NCR... Government is making efforts to remove all difficulties of people of Delhi,‚Äù Mr. Modi said

title: Telangana Government deliberately damaging Kaleshwaram motor pumps, alleges BRS MLA Harish Rao
content: Speaking to reporters at Siddipet, Harish Rao said he saw a criminal conspiracy and the Government must come clean

title: Telangana Congress Committee PAC meeting on August 23 likely to finalise BC reservations, local body polls dates
content: Sources said the PAC meeting on August 23 is expected to finalise strategies on these important matters

title: Tamil Nadu Governor¬†doing ‚Äòcheap politics‚Äô than Opposition: CM Stalin
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announces ‚ÄòDravidian Model 2.0‚Äô for 2026 elections and launches an instant crop loan scheme in Dharmapuri

title: Siddaramaiah should apologise for allowing smear campaign against Dharmasthala temple, says Vijayendra
content: Mr. Vijayendra urged the Karnataka government to reveal the details of the ‚Äúconspiracy‚Äù to tarnish the reputation of the Dharmasthala temple and its administrators

title: High Court orders Andhra Pradesh Government to strictly adhere to IRC guidelines related to speed-breakers¬†
content: The judges ordered the respondents to ensure that the existing speed-breakers are brought in¬†conformity to the latest guidelines and new speed-breakers are also constructed accordingly

title: Search for trapped cloudburst victims enters fourth day in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar
content: Rescuers are utilising over a dozen earth-movers and other heavy equipment while the NDRF mobilised its resources, including dog squads, to speed up the rescue operation

title: APSCHE to organise State-level faculty development programme on Quantum Technologies from August 18
content: The programme will continue in phases till April 2026, combining online and offline modules, including hands-on training in quantum systems and laboratory environments

title: In frames | Nutty delight
content: Kashmir records a bumper almond harvest this season, boosting farmer incomes; however, weather shifts, imports, and shrinking farmland remain key concerns

title: Tripura's heath-care system 'completely collapsed' under BJP government, alleges Congress
content: Congress spokesperson Prabir Chakraborty alleged that instead of delivering quality health care, Tripura has witnessed corruption and medical negligence, leading to deaths

title: Retired Army officer killed in hit-and-run in Jaipur; accused driver gets bail
content: On August 15, retired Army Captain Narsa Ram Jajda was cycling on the Gandhi Path stretch in Jaipur, when an SUV mowed him down before speeding away

title: Watch: Why are marginal farmers in India‚Äôs grape capital rejoicing about UK FTA? | Pulse Maharashtra
content: In this episode, we will discuss why thousands of farmers staying over 7000 kilometres away from London, are excited about the India ‚Äì UK Free Trade Agreement

title: Grassland invaders stifle Assam‚Äôs¬†island-like national park
content: A new study has marked at least two native plants that have joined invasive species to alter the natural structure of Dibru-Saikhowa National Park, the only habitat of feral horses in India

title: India‚Äôs easternmost railway zone shifts to compostable bio-plastic on trains
content: The biodegradable material to package bedrolls was developed at the Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati

title: Supreme Court takes suo motu cognisance of plight of cadets suffering disability during military training
content: A Bench of Justices B.V. Nagarathna and R. Mahadevan will be hearing the case on August 18, after a media report flagged the issue of these cadets

title: Maharashtra rain: Flash flood risk in Konkan, Mumbai amid heavy downpour
content: According to a press release by IMD, flash flood risk likely over neighbourhoods of North Goa, South Goa, Mumbai City, Palghar, Raigarh, Ratnagiri, Sindhudurg and Suburban Mumbai districts during the next 24 hours

title: Two dozen rounds fired outside YouTuber Elvish Yadav‚Äôs Gurugram home
content: Bike-borne attackers fire over two dozen rounds at YouTuber Elvish Yadav‚Äôs home in Gurugram; no injuries reported

title: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri arrives in Nepal for two-day visit
content: The Foreign Secretary will call on President Ramchandra Paudel and Prime Minister K P Sharma Oli and pay a courtesy call on Foreign Minister Arzu Rana Deuba

title: Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs ‚ÄòVote Adhikar Yatra‚Äô LIVE: In the entire country, vote theft is going on, says Rahul Gandhi
content: Speaking at the rally, Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said ‚ÄúThe Election Commission has become an agent of the government.‚Äù

title: Cloudbursts, landslip hit Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs Kathua; at least seven dead | LIVE
content: Army presses choppers into rescue operation in Kathua; J&K CM Omar Abdullah announced an ex-gratia of ‚Çπ2 lakh to the families of those dead, ‚Çπ1 lakh to those seriously injured and ‚Çπ50,000 to those with minor injuries

title: When the streets become stages for artistes
content: Traditionally, therukoothu revolves around epics; contemporary narratives found place in such shows after Koothu-P-Pattarai, a modern theatre group, was founded by Na. Muthusamy

title: Kathua cloudbursts, landslip: At least seven dead, five injured
content: Five people died in Jodh Ghati, which was hit by the cloudburst; two people lost their lives in landslip triggered by rains at Janglote area

title: Shubhanshu Shukla returns to India; likely to meet PM Modi
content: Mr. Shukla was part of the Axiom-4 private space mission that lifted off from Florida on June 25 and docked at the International Space Station on June 26; he returned to Earth on 15 July

title: AP Chambers welcomes two-slab GST system, says it reduces compliance burden
content: The new tax system provides big relief to the MSMEs, enabling them to recover and grow, says Chambers president Potluri Bhaskara Rao

title: Gouthu Latchanna‚Äôs struggles for the oppressed classes truly inspiring, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The veteran freedom fighter and social reformer symbolises the spirit of struggle, efficiency and courage, he says in a post on X

title: Heavy rain likely in North Coastal A.P. until August 19 as fresh low pressure brewing over Bay of Bengal
content: IMD has issued orange alert for Visakhapatnam, Vizianagaram, Kakinada, Anakapalli, Alluri Sitharama Raju districts on August 17

title: Drowning has claimed 7,798 lives in Odisha since 2020
content: Experts believe most of these deaths are preventable underscoring urgent need for a public health intervention

title: Family of nurse found dead in Bengal‚Äôs Singur demands CBI probe
content: The family members of the nurse had refused the post mortem of the nurse‚Äôs body at a government run facility on Friday. On Saturday the post mortem was conducted at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Kalyani

title: Kathua boy finds voice after eight years of silence, thanks to Army doctor
content: Born with a cleft lip and palate, Akshay underwent a surgery but was still unable to speak; Captain Salunkhe trained the boy personally in speech therapy

title: Congress releases list of 71 district presidents in M.P.; OBC leaders given maximum representation
content: Senior party leader Digvijaya Singh's MLA son and former State Minister Jaivardhan Singh has been made Guna district president

title: What are the challenges confronting the EC? | Explained
content: Why is the Election Commission of India in the eye of a storm? What are the allegations raised by the Opposition? What happened after the draft electoral roll was released in Bihar? What is the Supreme Court‚Äôs interim order? How are migrant voters going to be affected by the SIR?

title: West Bengal teacher who lost job after SC verdict dies of ‚Äòstress-induced‚Äô stroke
content: Mr. Soren had been a prominent figure at the forefront of the agitations and had been present in multiple instances when police clashed with protesting teachers.

title: How document deficits may risk disenfranchising the poor, eroding trust in the Election Commission
content: Economic location is a major factor in terms of document possession; gap extends to entire families ‚Äî only about one in every 10 poor households said every adult member had a birth certificate

title: Set up parallel bridges on a war footing: islanders
content: All-party delegation coordinated by FRAG to meet the Chief Minister with a request for setting up parallel bridges to the first and third Goshree bridges

title: DMK is not the AIADMK to be afraid of Enforcement Directorate raids, says CM
content: Speaking at the CPI State conference, Stalin said the Union government was threatening leaders¬†of Opposition parties; DMK alliance will win in 2026 Assembly poll, defeating all such plots, he said

title: "Those Who Dance With Constitution Trampled It": PM's Law Jab At Congress
content: Targeting the Opposition and senior Congress leader, Rahul Gandhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today alleged that "those who dance with the Constitution on their heads" kept oppressive laws in place for decades before he started repealing them.

title: 72-Year-Old Grandmother Holds Drip Bottle For 30 Minutes At Madhya Pradesh Hospital
content: A 72-year-old woman was forced to hold a drip bottle for nearly half an hour for her injured grandson at Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel District Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Satna, after hospital staff failed to provide a drip stand.

title: "New Conspiracy To Steal Bihar Elections": Rahul Gandhi Attacks Poll Body
content: Rahul Gandhi's comments came during the launch of his 1,300 km-long 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' from Bihar's Sasaram.

title: 8 Dead, 4 Missing As Flash Floods Hit China, Rescue Ops Underway
content: The Ministry of Emergency Management has ordered full-scale rescue efforts, verification of the status of the missing, and dispatched a working group to the scene.

title: Police Apprehend Teenager For Sexual Assault, Murder Of 5-Year-Old Boy
content: A teenager has been apprehended for allegedly sexually assaulting and murdering a five-year-old boy, police said on Sunday.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates 2 Highway Projects In Big Push To Declog Delhi
content: In a major infrastructure push to ease traffic congestion and reduce travel time across Delhi and several other cities in the National Capital Region, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will shortly inaugurate two major projects

title: Opinion: Opinion | Dhadak 2, Vidhi, And An 'Ambiguous' Rebellion
content: Dhadak 2 presents a complex portrait of a female protagonist whose rebellion is not insincere but restricted. Her existence is mired with compassion but also propped up by privilege.

title: CCTV Shows 2 Men Raining Bullets On Elvish Yadav's Gurugram House
content: CCTV footage surfaced showing two men firing at the controversial YouTuber and Bigg Boss OTT winner Elvish Yadav's house in Gurugram on Sunday morning.

title: 7 Killed After Cloudburst, Landslide In Jammu And Kashmir's Kathua, Rescue Ops On
content: At least seven people were killed and many others were injured in two separate incidents of cloudburst and landslide in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district, officials said on Sunday.

title: Odisha Police Constable Found Hanging From Tree, Husband Charged With Abetment To Suicide
content: The body of a female police constable was found hanging from a tree near the Nuapada railway station in Odisha on Saturday, officials said.

title: How Europe Plans To Avoid Another Showdown As Trump Meets Zelensky Tomorrow
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky may not be alone when he reaches Washington on Monday for his meeting with US President Donald Trump, amid global efforts towards bringing an end to the three-year-long Russia-Ukraine war.

title: West Bengal Cops Recover Stolen Padma Shri Award Of Ex-Swimmer In 48 Hours, 1 Arrested
content: The sleuths of Criminal Investigation Department of West Bengal Police have recovered the stolen Padma Shri award of internationally acclaimed (former) Indian swimmer, also an Arjuna Award winner, Bula Chowdhury, within 48 hours from time of theft.

title: Man Arrested For Sending Bomb-Laden Speaker To Husband Of Woman He Loved
content: A 20-year-old electrician from Chhattisgarh allegedly planted an improvised explosive device (IED) in a music system speaker and sent it as a gift to the husband of a woman he was infatuated with, police said on Sunday.

title: Chhattisgarh Cabinet Expansion Likely Tomorrow, These Leaders May Be Included
content: Political activity has intensified in Chhattisgarh with Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai expected to expand his cabinet by Monday.

title: Navi Mumbai Man Cheated Of Rs 1.47 Crore In Decade-Old Flat Scam
content: Police have registered a case against a real estate company director and two others for allegedly cheating a man of Rs 1.47 crore after promising him six flats with the amount in Navi Mumbai a decade ago, officials said on Sunday.

title: 5 Killed In Bengaluru Building Fire, Owners Arrested For Safety Violations
content: A fire broke out in a building in the Nagarathpete area of Bengaluru on Saturday, killing five people, officials said.

title: Mass Resignations, Massive Protests As Congress Announces Madhya Pradesh District Chiefs
content: Six MLAs, eight former MLAs and three former ministers have been given district-level responsibilities, which has angered workers who feel grassroots leaders were overlooked.

title: "Unwise For A Human To Copy Paste AI Text": Zoho Chief Sridhar Vembu's Big Warning
content: Sridhar Vembu shared how he uses AI daily, describing himself as a "moderate to heavy" user with two to three sessions a day.

title: Germany Proposes Trump-Putin-Zelensky Trilateral Meet To Be Held In Europe
content: A three-way summit US President Donald Trump has mooted with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and Russian President Vladimir Putin could take place in Europe, Germany's leader suggested.

title: Woman Crying Doesn't 'Per Se' Prove Dowry Harassment: Delhi High Court
content: The Delhi High Court has held that mere fact that a woman was crying, cannot per se make out any case of dowry harassment.

title: Shwetha Menon | Madam president
content: The actor has been elected the first woman president of the Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes, which was rocked by the revelations of the Hema Committee last year

title: Farmers to lay siege to Vidhana Soudha in Bengaluru on August 20
content: A ‚Äòsatyagraha‚Äô will be held at Freedom Park in Bengaluru, says H. Bhagyaraj, president of the Karnataka State Sugarcane Growers‚Äô Association

title: U.S. team may defer August 25 India visit for trade pact talks: official
content: The U.S. is pressing for greater market access in politically sensitive areas such as agri and dairy sectors, which India cannot accept as it affects the livelihood of small and marginal farmers

title: Defeated candidate wins after SC recounts votes in sarpanch election
content: The recount, done by a Registrar of the Supreme Court under video surveillance in the Supreme Court, turned the election result on its head. Mohit Kumar, who had been declared as defeated in the previous result, won by a good margin in the election to a Haryana gram panchayat

title: Karnataka Kolhapuri Chappal makers seek PRADA‚Äôs support
content: ‚ÄòMost of the production of Kolhapuri chappals happens in Karnataka, while most of the sale happens in Maharashtra. They are named after the city they are sold in, not made in‚Äô

title: NCERT module blames Congress for Partition; party says Hindu Mahasabha first suggested the idea
content: Congress, Jinnah and Lord Mountbatten were responsible for Partition, says module meant for Classes 6 to 8; Congress calls it distortion of history

title: Centre should not have asked President to issue Reference, says Kerala
content: Kerala agreed with T.N.‚Äôs stand that the April 8 judgment on prescribing timelines for the President and Governors had comprehensively dealt with every single question of law raised in the Presidential Reference

title: Manipur Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla to hold additional charge of Nagaland
content: Mr. Bhalla has been given the additional charge in the wake of the demise of Nagaland Governor La. Ganesan on August 15

title: Jharkhand lifts night shift ban for women
content: The entire responsibility of the safety and security of women employees will be of the concerned company and its management; the consent of the women employees who will be made to work in night shift is also mandatory

title: Govt. sanctions ‚Çπ54 crore for VETRI Palligal to prepare students for JEE, NEET
content: According to a government order, VETRI Palligal in every block would help Class 11 and 12 students get into premier higher education institutions

title: Bengaluru fire accident: Narrow lanes made rescue operations a Herculean task
content: As the fire broke out at the unit containing plastic and packing material, the fire spread rapidly, covering the entire building

title: Rashtrapati Bhavan responds to SOS email by parents of R.G. Kar victim
content: Email response directs the victim‚Äôs parents to liaise with the President‚Äôs aide; they had reached out to Rashtrapati Bhavan thrice since their daughter‚Äôs death, but to no avail

title: Neelam Social releases documentary on conservancy workers‚Äô protests
content: Founded by filmmaker Pa. Ranjith, Neelam Cultural Centre‚Äôs YouTube channel especially focusses on social and political issues faced by the marginalised sections of the in society

title: Major irregularities in 2024 Maharashtra Assembly polls, claims Vote for Democracy report
content: A constituency-level study of the election alleges unexplained voter surges, data mismatches, and procedural lapses; the report warns of ‚Äòweaponisation‚Äô of India‚Äôs election system and calls for urgent reforms

title: An anonymous life without an¬†Aadhaar¬†identity
content: A number of people from tribal communities across Maharashtra face barriers to accessing education, health care, and government schemes because they are not registered with the Unique Identification Authority of India, finds¬†Purnima Sah

title: No foreign voters in Bihar SIR list; Modi brings divisive agenda: CPI(ML)
content: Countering PM Narendra Modi‚Äôs statement on Independence Day that illegal immigration is threatening the country‚Äôs demography, CPI(ML) general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya says the SIR exercise in Bihar did not bring out a single case of illegal immigrants in the State

title: Monthly premium for Phase 2 of Medisep enhanced to ‚Çπ750
content: Government issues order approving Phase 2 of Medisep which offers an enhanced basic coverage of ‚Çπ5 lakh. The scheme has been revamped as per the recommendations of an expert committee

title: Utmost transparency in preparing electoral rolls: Election Commission of India
content: In a statement, the Commission says some political parties did not examine the electoral rolls at the appropriate time and did not point out errors

title: No foreign nationals in Bihar SIR: CPI (ML) Liberation questions PM's 'infiltrator' remark
content: CPI(ML) leader criticises Modi‚Äôs anti-immigrant agenda, challenges claims of illegal immigrants in Bihar SIR, ahead of opposition‚Äôs Vote Adhikar Yatra

title: Only legally valid cases should be admitted in AC courts, says Karnataka Revenue Minister¬†
content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda on Saturday warned Assistant Commissioners against admitting cases beyond their legal jurisdiction

title: Fantasy baseball news: Duran carted off, Muncy sidelined with oblique strain
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the remaining 14 games were played under the lights, with four more matinees following, with the final 10 games being evening affairs . for the second straight day, action gets underway at 2:20 p.m. ET .

title: The NBA schedule is out! Best games -- and beefs -- to watch
content: the regular season begins Oct. 21 with reigning NBA champion Kevin Durant 's new team, the Houston Rockets . leBron James , Luka Doncic and the Los Angeles Lakers host Stephen Curry and the Golden State Warriors . plenty of stars will don new jerseys setting up must-see reunions and playoff rematches as the season approaches .

title: ‚õ≥ Augusta National ditches masses for revenue
content: the 2026 "Official Masters Hospitality" program includes offers of housing, transportation, catering and so on to the corporate and/or well-heeled . the "Full Scale, Private Home Program," which will run you a mere $219,600 for the week, comes days after the announcement that a local Hooters restaurant is closing .

title: From 'KGB' to Central Michigan: What we learned, and didn't learn, from the Michigan report
content: Connor Stalions referred to his advanced sign-stealing operation as both "counterintelligence" and "the KGB" the former Michigan staffer called the video it elicited "dirty film" and ultimately threw his phone in a pond . the punishments for that operation arrived on Friday .

title: NFL preseason Week 2 takeaways: Giants rookie QB Jaxson Dart continues red-hot summer
content: the Packers beat the Colts 23-19 in a preseason win . the first-round pick finished 14-of-16 for 137 yards with a TD passing and another rushing . this came on the heels of an impressive debut against the Bills .

title: Emotion-filled Liverpool summon inner strength for dramatic win
content: Antoine Semenyo scores twice in the second half to cancel out goals from Hugo Ekitike and Cody Gakpo . a minute's silence was observed in memory of Diogo Jota and his brother Andr√© Silva . anfield paid an emotional tribute to the portuguese forward .

title: üèà Fantasy Football Draft Guide: All you need

title: What NFL scouts make of Arch Manning, what Texas can expect from him
content: arch Manning will get his chance to be the face of the longhorns this season . he won't get the chance to ease into the starting role as top-ranked Texas will play at defending national champion and no. 3-ranked Ohio State in its season opener on august 30 .
